intro: Hieracium abietopsis, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils and cooler climates. The plant features a rosette of basal leaves that are covered in fine hairs, and its flowering stems bear yellow composite flowers. It is part of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its daisy-like flower heads. Due to its habitat preferences, it is often found at high altitudes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
